content.question: However, strong evidence indicates that this event did not inspire the poem and that the author was in fact Sarah Josepha Hale, not Roulstone. Should the writer keep or delete the underlined text?

choices.label: Keep it, because it indicates why the story of Roulstone’s composition is described as “charming” in sentence 5.
Keep it, because it previews the way the rest of the passage will support the thesis about Hale’s authorship with evidence.
Delete it, because it contains unimportant information that distracts from the statement of the thesis.
Delete it, because it contradicts the discussion of Roulstone’s childhood in the first paragraph.

content.answer: Keep it, because it previews the way the rest of the passage will support the thesis about Hale’s authorship with evidence.
